parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A vision, supernatural appearance. From a presumed derivative of optanomai; visuality, i.e. an apparition.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
